description: From Middle English *worthles, from Old English weorþlēas (“worthless”), equivalent to worth +‎ -less. Cognate with Dutch waardeloos (“worthless”), German wertlos (“worthless”), Swedish värdelös (“worthless”).

adjectives.description: worthless (comparative more worthless or worthlesser, superlative most worthless or worthlessest)

entries.meaning: Having no worth or use; without value.
examples: Synonyms: miserable, useless, valueless, inconsequential; see also Thesaurus:worthless
Antonyms: precious, useful, valuable, worthful, worthy
Lies are as important as truth, for without lies, the truth is worthless.
The committee's decision is worthless and not going to be acted upon.
Don't be a worthless slouch! Go get yourself a job.
